title: I love it when i go down to river and find an enemy doing scuttle crab
body:
But scuttle's health bar doesn't show up until 2 seconds later when its too late to realize it was very low health and stealable

replies.body:
I know people here will defend the crab and would now call it vital for vision. I've never seen why, its far more of a nuisance than an objective.  It breaks traps has caused problems with some river engagements which has saved enemies and for vision just put a ward instead. 

I have also seem to have stop doing crab to gank when theirs a window or to counter gank. Seems to me if you have time to do crabs you have time to gank. Maybe with the gold increase it might be worth it.

Scuttie is a good way for junglers to get early game gold as well as control around objectives. The vision can be used to spot champions and the speed boost could be used for fleeing or engaging. In the early game, I always get scuttie when up if I have a champion that can CC it. Its basically free gold if no one contests it.
Basically free gold and free sustain that  0 dps scuttle gives is op
It technically has like 60 AD
Yes, but it has no DPS :D

Scuttle is love. Scuttle is life.

I know it's helped me when I first start jungling and I'm too low on health to take another camp. Not only does it give me extra gold (that is getting buffed to 70 gold next patch X3) but it also heals you a enough that you just might be able to gank or take another camp before recalling.
It's kinda dangerous if you do that; unless you know where the enemy jungler is, of course.

The fear can help, I think. Honestly, what I'm talking about is if you're takin scuttle when you're someone like Warwick. Have you ever tried takin scuttie as Warwick?

**flashback**

*shivers*
WW can at least chase. Fiddle can't. His best chance is to fear it at the end of the river and *hope* it doesn't break his tether.
Or you could just 'push' crab inside Dragon // Baron pit so it doesn't move.
Also with some champions is useful to recover resources like health or fury {{champion:421}} {{champion:107}}

I would like to see it but i don't. 

I had a game where i had a friend who is a jungler main and he loves the crab.  He would tell me all the time to get the crab that vary moment and i always had a reason to avoid it. 

Stripping the enemies jungle, Placing deep wards in the enemy jungle and, Ganking or Counter Ganking

Come to think of it the only time i am really ever in river is to ward. Most ganks i have done where straight from lane with the greatest success. People are to aggressive in solo q.

Like i said though with the gold increase coming i will consider it,  Yet if your doing crabs i am doing your jungle or getting a kill. I am vary aggressive jungler i get enemy blue or red and maybe sometimes first blood at level 2

Taking scuttles let's you ward in other places as well. Potential 5 wards from you instead of 4 (counting pinks amd what not). Also gives you XP, gold, and a nice speed boost. A team fight at drag or baron can easily be decided by who has control of scuttles.

crab has to small of a vision control and still doesn't have full vision inside dragon pit. 

The times i do kill crab i still place a ward because of it. Crab + ward OP right. 

At this vary moment XP and Gold is meh to me when i am taking your camps and taking lanes. Why do crab when you can do 2 camps in the time frame chasing him around. 

Speed boost is a nice bonus, but like i said i dont gank from river much and i usually only do dragon when the enemy is dead. Ward or not when no one is around to contest dragon it doesn't matter, I don't go for sneaky dragons. 

With my 1 ward and there confidence of crab vision control i have killed several dozen people trying to sneak drag. I have benefited far more giving crab up.

It sounds stupid, but it works for me.

Tbh, i only take crab when i have the golem buff from smite or red buff to slow it down, and if you do enough damage it's not that long chasing it around. If you are playing a champion that has no CC besides the golem buff, red buff and the smite slow (if you go that route in your jungle build) you'll probably only spend a maximum of 20 seconds chasing it around town.
Despite the free gold, the sustain and the minute vision it gives you a little speed buff, which can help gank lanes or flee from a fight.

Actually i love warding. I am known to ward excessively far more then most supports as jungler. 

I ended up some games with 30+ wards, But like i said before only reason to go into river was to ward dragon or enemy jungle and i still walk past the crab.

But...the crab is a ward that *gives* you gold.
It also heals you a bit, even on non-sustain junglers. (Killing it procs a little regen thing, even without the mastery.)

1st kill on it is also insanely easy and fast on nearly any jungler.
After 1st..I kind of just agro it and poke at it while controlling it's movements to move it/keep it toward the lane I want to gank soon. Watch the lane..if anything exciting happens, abandon crab and go gank. If nothing is happening..just finish the crab.

Where if you just go gank...your allies might not be in the right spot, so you have to wait for something to happen, which is just wasted time when you could be sustaining off the crab, while doing said waiting, win/win.
There's no reason not to agro the crab, as it doesn't attack back, unless you just can't control it's movements. Then...you probably need to work on your attack-move.

Scuttle Crab is practically free Exp and potential Level up for sustain for a likelihood of a Level 3 pressure in any lane before even backing once. Nocturne Players sincerely love it :)

Scuttle control is pretty integral as  jungle, if you can maintain control of both scuttles, it acts as a strong line of vision between your jungle and and their jungle Throw a couple of wards in a few other spots, no one will enter your jungle or their jungle without your knowedge. 

Plus having that MS boost in baron and dragon fights are incredibly important for disengages and collapses.
